entry.title: Come get me out of California
entry.summary:
Author: tofana

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,636Chapters: 1/9Kudos: 0

entry.title: Dirty Pretty Pain
entry.summary:
Author: hearmyplea

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,368Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 0

Summary: “There’s a tape recorder- I’ll… I’ll play it.” Buck says, uncertainty lacing his words.“Hello, Evan.” The voice is hard to hear from Eddie’s vantage point, but he feels his stomach drop. He knows the voice. He’s been informed about the jigsaw killer and his methods. So has Buck. Eddie can see Buck’s soul crushing in his expression alone.This is their end.-Eddie and Buck wake up to find themselves in the worst kind of situation.9-1-1 / SAW AU

entry.title: The Disappearance of T'Eddie II (and Buck's Sanity)
entry.summary:
Author: tinypeckers

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,379Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: Day 105 of 105 days of 9-1-1 hiatusWhen Buck's beloved build-a-bear, T'Eddie II, goes missing from the firehouse, everyone is a suspect until an anonymous text confirms what Buck knew all along: There is only one person devious enough to kidnap T'Eddie II, one person who has made it his lifelong mission to torment Buck, one person who Buck is determined to take down, once and for all. And his name? Brody Mother F**king Puckett.

entry.title: Everything fits
entry.summary:
Author: ParadiseDarkness26

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,149Chapters: 2/14Kudos: 6

Summary: Eddie returns to Los Angeles after accepting his true identity, but he still fears sharing it. Meanwhile, his best friend Buck discovers that he has a son and must learn how to be a father. Amid the chaos of parenthood and living together, Eddie starts to see Buck in a different light, which leads him to question whether he's ready to face his truth and risk everything to be who he truly is.

entry.title: Not Just A Key
entry.summary:
Author: Passion4Words

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,653Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 3

Summary: Buck knows that he probably should have learned his lesson from the last time he walked into Eddie’s house unannounced, because the last time he did that, his world came crashing down around him as he listened to Eddie explain that he was looking for a house in El Paso.Then again, Buck wasn’t really one to learn from his own mistakes much.At least, not when it came to matters of the heart.And that’s exactly what Eddie is, as Buck had come to realize so suddenly, but that was beside the point. The point right now is, he should not have walked in unannounced, because if he hadn’t, then he wouldn’t be starting at a scene right out of his nightmares.

entry.title: there's only love
entry.summary:
Author: wenttoafortuneteller

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 47,509Chapters: 6/6Kudos: 250

Summary: “You’re gonna have a good time once you’re there,” Buck continues, and Eddie knows he’s right— knows that any time spent with Hen is enjoyable; that Karen, though he hasn’t hung out with her in this capacity before, is a delight; that he could really use a distraction from the misery that is his life. Right now, though, Eddie wants to curl into a ball, tuck himself underneath the passenger seat, and decompose right into the Jeep’s recently-refurbished car flooring. That wouldn’t be fair to Buck, though. Lately, Eddie’s felt like his entire existence has been unfair to Buck. Five new things Eddie learns about himself in Christopher’s absence, and one thing he rediscovers.(Written for 9-1-1 Gotcha for Gaza.)

entry.title: i'm a shameless caller (you're a full machine)
entry.summary:
Author: lauriesamy

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,942Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 51

Summary: In a moment of weakness, distracted by the look in Eddie’s eyes Buck stuttered “I love you.”He wasn’t proud of it. Buck promised he wouldn’t make things harder for Eddie. He knew that there was nothing he could say that would make him stay, he wouldn’t want that either anyway. As much as Buck wants to be selfish and ask Eddie to stay with him, he never could, he’d never do that to Eddie and Chris.But he does love Eddie. Buck loves Eddie so much that he’d let him leave because that’s what you're supposed to do when you love somebody. You let them leave when they have to, even if it kills you.Eddie’s lips curled at Buck’s words. If Buck wasn’t mistaken, he could see Eddie’s eyes well up as well. “You too,” he whispered.He patted his hand on Buck’s shoulder for the last time before removing it, forever. Buck felt a sense of loneliness creeping over him at the loss of Eddie’s final touch. Eddie looked up at him one last time, matching tears in both of their eyes before stepping back—stepping away forevermore. OR: when Eddie moves to El Paso, he stops answering Buck’s calls, it causes Buck to lose his mind just a bit.

entry.title: always on the tip of my tongue
entry.summary:
Author: bookinit

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,202Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 29

Summary: The thing about running back into fires is that there’s a limit to how many times you can do it. Eventually, the smoke inhalation wears you down. Buck exhales, and inhales, and exhales. What’s that thing Eddie likes to say?Jello. He’s jello. Maybe lime, or maybe cherry. Like blood. Like cold medicine on a day you’re faking sick just to feel your mom’s hand on your forehead. Like hospital food. Like fucking cherry jello, and nothing else.Eddie doesn’t know shit.—or: eddie’s moving. buck’s dealing with it.

entry.title: Opperation - Get My Dad’s Together
entry.summary:
Author: suki_pooks

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,037Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 30

Summary: All Chris wants is his dad and Buck to be happy, of course, he loves them. They need to get past this, this staring at each other and then looking away bullshit, and just get together. No more, Ms. Floreses and Marisols and Tommys. It was time for an intervention. So one Thursday night Chris finds himself writing “Operation - Get My Dads Together”, and underlining it at the top of a notebook page.

entry.title: the song of asystole
entry.summary:
Author: edsdiaz

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,814Chapters: 3/5Kudos: 26

Summary: He walks in with his head down, hoping that he can just slip in and out.“Oh, there he is!” Eddie freezes in his tracks.Now, he’s aware grief is different for everyone and can make a person act irrationally, but does it make a person hallucinate their best friend who they just saw dead? A dead best friend who is still talking, “Cap was worried when you didn’t show up to work or answer your calls.”orThe Time Loop AU
